Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Pseudhymenochirin-1Pb (Ps-1Pb; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretions, Merlin's clawed frog,Pseudhymenochirus merlini, Africa

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against S. aureus (MIC 5-10 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 1.25-2.5 uM), E. faecalis (MIC 10 uM),  K. pneumoniae (20 uM),  P. aeruginosa (20 uM), A. baumannnii (5-10 uM), S. maltophilia (5-10 uM), E. coli (MIC 10 uM), and C. albicans (80 uM). The peptide is also activ eagainst select cancer cell lines (A549, MDA-231, HT-29, and HUVEC) (LC502.5-9.5 uM).Toxicity:  It is also moderate hemolytic (LC50 28 uM)(Mechkarska M et al. 2014).Structure:  The peptide is helical in 50% TFE and possesses insulin-releasing activity, thereby promising for treatment of patients with type 2 diabetes (T2D) (Manzo G et al., 2016). Updated 12/2014; 12/2015; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Conlon JM, Prajeep M, Mechkarska M, Coquet L, Leprince J, Jouenne T, Vaudry H, King JD.2013
Literature Information.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol Part D Genomics Proteomics. 2013 Oct 12;8(4):352-357.Pub-Med
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of the host-defense peptides from skin secretions of Merlin's clawed frog Pseudhymenochirus merlini: Insights into phylogenetic relationships among the Pipidae
